solution_line_template: She reduced the price of the ${cupcake_price_orig} cupcakes by half so they are now {cupcake_price_orig}/{price_reduction_divisor} = $<<{cupcake_price_orig}/{price_reduction_divisor}={cupcake_price_reduced}>>{cupcake_price_reduced}

She reduced the price of the ${cookie_price_orig} cookies by half so they are now {cookie_price_orig}/{price_reduction_divisor}= $<<{cookie_price_orig}/{price_reduction_divisor}={cookie_price_reduced}>>{cookie_price_reduced}

She sold {cupcakes_sold} cupcakes at ${cupcake_price_reduced} each so she made = {cupcakes_sold}*{cupcake_price_reduced} = $<<{cupcakes_sold}*{cupcake_price_reduced}={cupcake_revenue}>>{cupcake_revenue}
She sold {cookies_sold} cookies at ${cookie_price_reduced} each so she made {cookies_sold}*{cookie_price_reduced} = $<<{cookies_sold}*{cookie_price_reduced}={cookie_revenue}>>{cookie_revenue}

She made ${cupcake_revenue} from the cupcakes and ${cookie_revenue} from the cookies for a total of {cupcake_revenue}+{cookie_revenue} = $<<{cupcake_revenue}+{cookie_revenue}={total_revenue}>>{total_revenue}
